name: Adventure of the Little Rooster
description:
Everything changes the day the Little Rooster finds a shiny silver coin. Hilarious consequences and supreme shenanigans abound!

Dazzle and delight at this beloved folk tale performed with music, dance, puppets, circus and cabbage!

"It's impossible not to be charmed by Adventure of the Little Rooster.", says the Winnipeg Free Press.

Shows are 45 minutes in length and suitable for all ages.

name: Class From the Past: Holiday Workshops at Fort York
description: Step into the past and discover what school was like in Upper Canada in the early 1800s! Back then, only a few children could go to class and one-room schoolhouses were the center of learning. Who got to go and when did schools finally become free for everyone? Come find out as you explore the skills kids once learned; reading, writing, and practical lessons for everyday life. Try your hand at printing letters in a sand tray, then progress to writing on a slate just like real students did long ago. A fun, hands-on adventure for kids, teens, and families!

name: Light Up the Dark
description:
Step into a dazzling celebration of light and artistry.

Watch the Museum's front façade will come alive with mesmerizing projections by students and graduates from OCAD University's Experimental Animation program. 

Inspired by objects from our Museum Collections and current exhibition, As the Sun Appears from Beyond: Twenty Years of the Al Burda Award, these radiant displays will transform the night into a vibrant canvas of colour.

name: Make, Bake & Take Gingerbread Workshops for Children
description: Grate, pound and sift sugar and spices in the historic kitchen at Fort York National Historic Site and make an 1831 Gingerbread recipe to taste and take home to enjoy for the holidays. Share stories about ingredients and their histories, and enjoy a taste of Olive Bread  from Toronto History Museum's Chef in Residence, Chef Jean Régis Raynaud, owner of Le Baratin Restaurant.

name: The Mid-Century Modernes Matinee and Coat Drive
description:
The Mid-Century Modernes will bring their signature sound and high-energy performance for a special holiday matinee!

This festive afternoon will also serve as a clothing and essentials drive in support of those in need. Attendees are encouraged to bring coats, clothing of any kind, housewares, or gift cards, all of which will be gratefully accepted. 

Adding to the celebration, guests will have the opportunity to take part in a raffle featuring a pair of tickets to Rock of Ages, along with a very generous gift basket.

name: Cake Cabaret's Holiday Spectacular
description:
The holidays are heating up and you're invited.

Toronto's iconic performance venue is kicking off the festive season with its wildly entertaining Holiday Spectacular. 

Returning for a special run that also marks the venue's one-year anniversary, the 19+ burlesque-inspired experience blends dazzling performances, queer and body-positive energy and a playful sense of fun that sets the tone for the most magical season of the year.  

Naughty, nice, and everything in between, it's the most wonderfully wild show of the season.

name: We Might Need Therapy: Stand Up Comedy Showcase
description:
Come watch Toronto's darkest, silliest, goofiest, and most unhinged professional comedians tell their best jokes that will have you laughing all night.

This show has repeatedly sold out with performances by nationally touring comics featured on Netflix, Just For Laughs, Crave, Prime Video, CBC Radio and more.

So tell your friends, girlfriend, boyfriend, partner, dog walker and your mother too, while tickets last.
